clues.text: While tradition and songs say there were three of them, the Bible never specifies the number of these visitors.
Despite almost every painting depicting one, the Gospels never mention Mary riding this animal to Bethlehem.
The Bible never says Jesus was born in a stable or a cave, but specifically mentions he was placed here because there was no room in the guest room.
clues.answer: What is a manger (or feed trough)?

clues.text: While 'Hark the Herald Angels Sing' suggests otherwise, the Bible does not record the angels doing this specific action; it says they 'said' or 'praised.'
Often depicted as royalty, the Bible never refers to the Magi as these.
This 'major' prophet wrote, 'For unto us a Child is born, unto us a Son is given.'
The book of Micah predicted the Messiah would be born in this specific 'little' town.
In Matthew, the Holy Family flees to this country to fulfill the prophecy 'Out of [Blank] I called my son.'
Jeremiah 31 mentions a voice weeping in Ramah, foreshadowing this tragic event ordered by Herod.
clues.answer: What is the Massacre of the Innocents (or the killing of the baby boys)?

clues.text: The lineage of Jesus is often traced back to this son of Jacob, as the 'Lion of the tribe of [Blank].'
He was the father of John the Baptist and was struck mute until the baby was born.
In Matthew's genealogy, this King is the most famous ancestor listed, other than Abraham.
According to Luke 3, Jesus was 'supposedly' the son of Joseph, who was the son of this man (Joseph's father).
clues.answer: Who is Heli? (Note: Matthew lists Jacob; this is a great trivia nuance)

clues.text: This ruthlessly jealous King was the father of the Herod who later put Jesus on trial.
This woman is one of the few mentioned in Matthew's genealogy; she was not an Israelite but a Moabite.
Of the three gifts, this one is a hardened gum-like resin used in incense and perfume.
This gift, a dried sap used in embalming, symbolically pointed toward Jesus' future death.
In the Old Testament, this gift was often required for overlaying the Ark of the Covenant and Temple furniture.
According to Isaiah 60:6, camels from Midian and Ephah would bring gold and frankincense, but notably, this gift is omitted from the prophecy of the future Kingdom.
clues.answer: What is Myrrh? (Because Myrrh symbolizes death/suffering, which won't exist in the future Kingdom)

clues.text: In the ancient world, Frankincense was harvested primarily from trees in this region (modern-day Oman/Yemen).
clues.answer: What is Arabia (or the Arabian Peninsula)?

clues.text: What the shepherds did when they arrived at the manger to honor the baby.
You use this tool to chop firewood for the Yule log (or to spread butter).
This body part might be 'bowed' in prayer.
To rap on a door, like Joseph seeking room at the inn.
A skill or certainty; in the Bible, the Tree of [This] of Good and Evil.
We often depict the Magi arriving the night of the birth, but Matthew 2:11 says they entered this structure, not a stable.
While Christmas cards show a bright star over the manger, the Bible only mentions the star appearing to these people.
clues.answer: Who are the Magi (Wise Men)? (The shepherds were guided by an angel, not the star)

clues.text: Herod ordered the death of boys in Bethlehem under this age, suggesting Jesus may have been a toddler when the Wise Men arrived.
The Bible never actually says Jesus was born on December 25th; this date was likely chosen to coincide with (or replace) this Roman winter solstice festival.
Tradition says the forbidden fruit in Eden was an apple (often associated with Christmas ornaments), but the Hebrew text simply calls it this.
This prophet predicted the Messiah would be born in Bethlehem.
He prophesied: 'For unto us a Child is born, Unto us a Son is given'.
This major prophet is often called the 'Weeping Prophet'.
He foresaw the suffering servant in chapter 53 of his book.
This prophet married Gomer to illustrate God's love for unfaithful Israel.
This prophet leaped in his mother's womb when Mary (pregnant with Jesus) walked into the room.
A chocolate bar named 'Baby [Blank],' or the Moabitess who was the great-grandmother of David.
'Ice Ice Baby' is a song by Vanilla Ice; this is the 'Ice' that covers the top of Mount Hermon year-round.
Moses was a baby hidden in a basket made of papyrus and this sticky substance (also used on Noah's Ark).
In 1 Kings 3, this wise King suggested cutting a baby in half to determine the real mother.
This popular soda company is often credited with solidifying the modern image of Santa Claus in red and white suits in the 1930s.
'Jingle Bells' was not originally written for Christmas, but for this American holiday.
Good King Wenceslas looked out on the Feast of Stephen, which falls on this date (the day after Christmas).
In the song 'The Twelve Days of Christmas,' the 'Golden Rings' actually refer to these birds, not jewelry (keeping with the bird theme).
This ballet, now a Christmas staple, was a total flop when it premiered in Russia in 1892.
This actor, whose first name is a festive prickly plant, played Michael Scott's girlfriend in The Office and the voice of Elastigirl.
He's the 'Saint' of an actor who starred in Leaving Las Vegas and National Treasure.
This 'song-like' lady was the first female writer for Saturday Night Live and starred in The Burnett Show.
Her first name is the night before Christmas; she is the rapper who starred in the TV show Queens and had a hit with 'Let Me Blow Ya Mind.'
This actress shares a name with the frankincense-bearing visitors; she famously starred in Donnie Darko and The Dark Knight.
Jesus' first miracle, performed at a wedding in Cana.
Jesus fed 5,000 people with 2 fish and 5 of these.
Jesus walked on this body of water.
Jesus raised this man from the dead after four days.
Jesus healed ten of these, but only one returned to thank him.
In Home Alone, Harry and Marv call themselves by this aquatic nickname before they change it to the 'Sticky Bandits.'
In National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation, Cousin Eddie kidnaps this corporate boss to demand a Christmas bonus.
This 1988 action movie features a heist at Nakatomi Plaza, led by Hans Gruber.
In The Santa Clause, Tim Allen is arrested for kidnapping and questioned by a psychiatrist played by this actor (also known for Judge Reinhold... wait, that's the actor's name).
clues.answer: Who is Judge Reinhold? (Great trivia/pun overlap)

clues.text: In A Christmas Story, Ralphie fears 'the chair' and prison bars after doing this to Scott Farkus.
clues.answer: What is beating him up (punching/fighting him)?

final_jeopardy.text: This apostle, a tax collector, wrote the first Gospel in the New Testament.
